snippet: Counterterrorism officials said they are far more concerned that a militant will enter the country in a quite typical way: legally, on a commercial airline flight.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept and Federal Bureau of Investigation officials say there is no truth to warnings from conservative groups and leading Republicans that militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria plan to enter the United States from Mexico to carry out terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: Counterterrorism officials said they are far more concerned that a militant will enter the country in a quite typical way: legally, on a commercial airline flight.

headline.main: U.S. Pushes Back Against Warnings That ISIS Plans to Enter From Mexico
headline.print_headline: U.S. Pushes Back Against Warnings That ISIS Plans to Enter From Mexico
